content: Track width is the distance between the center of the left wheel and the center of the right wheel on the same axle of a vehicle. This measurement is typically taken on the front wheels of a vehicle, as the track width can affect the handling and stability of a car. A wider track width can provide better stability, while a narrower track width can make a car more agile. It is also called wheelbase, it is the distance between the center of the front wheel and the center of the rear wheel.
